subject: Personal Finance
title: The Paradox of Choice
description: A fast breakdown of The Paradox of Choice for builders.

hook.text: A store with 24 jam flavors sold less than one with 6. Too many choices paralyze us.

buildup.text: Psychologist Barry Schwartz showed that more options often lead to worse decisions and less satisfaction.

discovery.text: With fewer choices, people decide faster, feel more confident, and are happier with what they picked.

twist.text: This applies to finance too. Too many investment options in a 401(k) leads people to choose nothing at all.

climax.text: Simplifying your financial life â€” fewer accounts, fewer investments â€” often produces better outcomes.

punchline.text: Less choice can mean better decisions.
